channel.title: Amazing Graphics card
channel.description: I want to get a beast computer, i was wondering if anyone could point out a graphics card that will be able to blow the roof of my house? ;D

item.title: Amazing Graphics card
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

xEnt:

[quote=cooper]My ATI Radeon 2400 HD PRO can run Crysis with a good framerate.

You must be running that on 800x600 resolution, with all lowest details. My 8800gt is more than twice as powerful as that, and i get about 27fps @ 1280x1024 on maxed out settings & 4xAA[/quote]
Either 800x600 or 1024x768. Some settings were low, some were medium, I don’t remember exactly as I haven’t played in a while. I played with the same settings on a Radeon x300 mobility and got about 9-17 fps.

Read full topic

item.title: Amazing Graphics card
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

I was an nvidia fan, went to ATI because of their price/performance. ATI Radeon 4890 id be going with, if your worried about PhysX, ATI have Havoc physics.

As for the tri-sli, crossfirex etc, the most you’d want is 2 cards, if your looking to have 4 GPU’s get 2x 2GPU cards (4870x2, 9800GX2 etc)

Nvidia drivers are better, though if your looking at benchmarks don’t go basing your decision on Crysis or far cry 2 benchmarks, as those 2 games are highly nvidia-biased.

My ATI Radeon 2400 HD PRO can run Crysis with a good framerate.

You must be running that on 800x600 resolution, with all lowest details. My 8800gt is more than twice as powerful as that, and i get about 27fps @ 1280x1024 on maxed out settings & 4xAA

Read full topic

item.title: Amazing Graphics card
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Nvidia has always had better drivers than ATI, on all operating systems, but especially linux. That is the main reason I go nvidia.

edit:
Besides, if they are that close, you won’t notice a difference.

Read full topic

item.title: Amazing Graphics card
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:35, topic:269638”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=355883.msg2773222#msg2773222 date=1241374526]
Ok, so if I were to buy a Graphics card < $300, should I go with the ATI HD Radeon 4890/4870, or the nVidia GTX 275/285, as a single card?
[/quote]

Nvidia GTX of course. :)[/quote]

Ok. I’ve seen the benchmarks for both 4890 and 275/285, and it seems that nVidia surpasses the ATI up until you get to higher res, and then then ATI surpasses it. But it also seems like the nVidia has a higher Idle and Load temp, even at the lower res… I’m so confused one which one to pick…

Read full topic

I was pretty surprised the first time I ran it, after hearing how intensive the game was supposed to be… all that from a graphics card I got new for <$50 :D[/quote]Pretty low resolution i bet. With my xfire 4850 on max with full aa @ 1280x1024 i get like 30fps average.

item.description:

Ollie:

tbh dont get the best card out there unless you really need it, you will save alot of money getting older, slightly less spec models(still damn fast within reason)…

That is good advice when buying any type of hardware, the price goes up almost exponentially with how new a certain technology is.

I would always go with nvidia however, because ATI drivers suck.
